meanings.definition: To borrow or obtain something without permission or payment.
meanings.sent1: Tom was bumming a pencil from his friend during the test.
meanings.sent2: She was caught bumming a book from the library without checking it out.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was bumming nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The sneaky raccoon was bumming food from the campsite.
meanings.sent5: The clever cat was bumming treats from the unsuspecting owner.

meanings.sent1: After losing the game, he was bumming about it all day.
meanings.sent2: She was bumming when she didn't get the job she wanted.
meanings.sent3: The puppy was bumming because it couldn't reach its favorite toy.
meanings.sent4: The child was bumming like a rain cloud on a sunny day.
meanings.sent5: The student was bumming over the low grade on the test.

meanings.definition: To spend time idly or in a lazy manner.
meanings.sent1: Instead of studying, he was bumming around on his phone.
meanings.sent2: She spent the weekend bumming on the couch watching movies.
meanings.sent3: The cat was bumming in the sun, enjoying a lazy afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The bear was bumming in the shade, taking a long nap.
meanings.sent5: The friends were bumming by the pool, relaxing and chatting.
